bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In The U.S. Circuit Court, Dist. of Wash. Northern Division.
In Re Application of Henry Craemer for Writ of Habeas Corpus, and relief thereon.
Notice to Sheriff.
FILED June 21 1897 IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT
div1.ab: A. Reeves Ayres CLERK By A. N. Moore. DEPUTY
div1.p: Pratt & Riddle, Attys for Petitioner. 309-310-311 Bailey Bldg.
United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Application of Henry Craemer for Writ of Habeas Corpus, and relief thereon. } No. 624 Præcipe.
To the Clerk fo the above entitled Court:
You wil please issue citation in the above entitled cause.
div1.ab: Pratt & Riddle Attys for Petitioner, Henry Craemer, and appelant issue. Issued.
div1.p: United States Circuit Court District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Application of Henry Craemer for Writ of Habeas Corpus, and relief thereon.
Præcipe.
Filed June 21 1897
div1.ab: A. Reeves Ayres Clerk. A. N. Moore. Deputy Clerk.
div1.p: Pratt & Riddle Attys for Petitioner, Henry Craemer
div1.ab: The President of the United States of America,
div1.p: To the Honorable the Judges of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

Whereas, lately in the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington before you, or some of you, in a cause between entitled In the matter of the application of Henry Craemer for a writ of habeas corpus wherein the order of the said Circuit Court entered in said cause on the 14th day of June, A.D. 1897, is in the following words, viz:
div1.ab: In the Matter of the Application of HENRY CRAEMER for Write of Habeas Corpus and Relief Thereon.
div1.p: This cause coming on for hearing upon the petition of petitioner for a writ of habeas corpus, the court, being advised upon the petition and upon hearing counsel for petitioner, denies and refuses to grant the said writ; to which ruling of the court petitioner excepts; exception allowed.

Petitioner thereupon gives notice that he appeals from the said ruling of the court and from the whole and every part thereof, and appeals his said petition and his said cause and the whole and each and every part thereof to the Supreme Court of the United States, holding terms at the city of Washington, District of Columbia, and to the next regular term thereof, and particularly appeals from said rulings of the said court denying and refusing to grant the said writ of habeas corpus.
Which said appeal is here and now allowed.
Done in open court this 14th day of June, 1897.
